page.title: 02Place Names in Wembley
page.content:
Many of our local place-names are derived from Saxon words and have meanings often related to local people or to land features. {WEMBLEY}- Wembalea (AD 825) Wemba's forest clearing. {ALPERTON}- Alprinton or Apperton (AD 1199) originally Eahlbeort's Farm. {OAKINGTON}(Tokyngton)-(AD 1171) "Tokinton" probably Tocca's Farm. {TWYFORD}- "Tueverde" (AD 1086) meaning a double ford. {PERIVALE}- from Greenford Parva. {BRENT}- "braegantan" (AD 972) "Brente" (AD 1274) meaning "holy river" {STONEBRIDGE}- A stone bridge was built here over the River Brent in the 17th. century.
<Dates refer to first known records>
